Class Restaurant

  • java.lang.Object
    • Restaurant

  • public class Restaurant
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is where the tests are run and acts as the restaurant we are simulating.
    Author:
    Craig Lombardo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Restaurant()
      This constructor method takes no parameters and instantiates the various tables and RandomGaussian number generators, the lists to keep track of customers, and loads the "scenario" or design strategy of the test.

      • Restaurant

        public Restaurant()
        This constructor method takes no parameters and instantiates the various tables and RandomGaussian number generators, the lists to keep track of customers, and loads the "scenario" or design strategy of the test.

    • Method Detail

      • addToCustomerCount

        public void addToCustomerCount(int num)
        This method adds to the total customer count.
        Parameters:
        num - The number of customers to add to the count.

      • setCustomerHandling

        public void setCustomerHandling(int seating,
                                int waiting)
        This method sets the which seating preference to use for the restaurant.
        Parameters:
        seating - The seating option (1-3)
        waiting - The waiting option (1-2)

      • setWaitingType

        public void setWaitingType(int type)
        This method sets the waiting type for the restaurant. Waiting type is the strategy for removing customers from the waiting list.
        Parameters:
        type - The waiting option (1-2)

      • getWaitingType

        public int getWaitingType()
        This method returns the waiting type for the restaurant. Waiting type is the strategy for removing customers from the waiting list.
        Returns:
        int The value of the waiting strategy (1-2)

      • getTimer

        public TimedEvents getTimer()
        This method returns the metaphorical timer, this method is used for testing purposes.
        Returns:
        TimedEvents Restaurant "timer".

      • getSeatedList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Customer> getSeatedList()
        This method returns an array corresponding to the list of seated customers.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The seated customer list

      • removeSeatedGroup

        public void removeSeatedGroup(Customer who)
        This method removes a seated group from their table.
        Parameters:
        who - The customer to remove from their seats.

      • setSeatingPrefToScenario1

        public void setSeatingPrefToScenario1()
        This method sets the seating options to scenario 1, in which small groups look to be seated at a table first, then the bar, and finally the oval. Large groups look to be seated at a booth first, then the oval and then finally the bar.

      • setSeatingPrefToScenario2

        public void setSeatingPrefToScenario2()
        This method sets the seating options to scenario 2, in which small groups look to be seated at the bar and then the oval and then finally a table. Large groups look to be seated at the oval and then the bar, and then finally the booths.

      • setSeatingPrefToScenario3

        public void setSeatingPrefToScenario3()
        This method sets the seating options to scenario 3, in which small groups look to be seated at the bar and then the tables and then finally the oval. Large groups look to be seated at the bar and then the booths, and then finally the oval. This final strategy ensures the two seating preferences are basically the same.

      • addSmallArrival

        public void addSmallArrival()
        This method adds to the small group arrival count.

      • addLargeArrival

        public void addLargeArrival()
        This method adds to the large group arrival count.

      • addSmallSeated

        public void addSmallSeated()
        This method adds to the small group seated count.

      • addLargeSeated

        public void addLargeSeated()
        This method adds to the large group seated count.

      • waitingOrder1

        public void waitingOrder1()
        This method sets the order of waiting list removal, scenario 1 for waiting list options.

      • waitingOrder2

        public void waitingOrder2()
        This method sets the order of waiting list removal, scenario 2 for waiting list options.

      • tryToSitNextWaitingCustomer

        public void tryToSitNextWaitingCustomer()
        This method tries to sit the next customer to be drawn from the waiting list.

      • canWeSeat

        public boolean canWeSeat(Customer who)
        This method is for the restaurant to check if a specified group can be seated. If so then they are added to the seatedGroups list and seated at the appropriate table, if not then they are added to the waiting list.
        Parameters:
        who - The customer we would like to
        Returns:
        boolean A boolean representing whether or not a customer was actually seated.

      • addToWaitingList

        public void addToWaitingList(Customer who)
        This method adds customers to the waiting list if a seat was not found for them.
        Parameters:
        who - The customer we are trying to seat.

      • removeFromWaitingList

        public void removeFromWaitingList(Customer who)
        This method removes customers from the waiting list.
        Parameters:
        who - The customer to remove from the waiting list.

      • getWaitingList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Customer> getWaitingList()
        This method returns the current waiting list for use in a sort of system of checks and balances.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The current Restaurant waiting list.

      • openRestaurant

        public void openRestaurant(int closeTime)
        This method acts as the restaurants doors "opening" and "closing". Time always starts at 0, and is measured in seconds; however, the user may specify when the restaurant closes. Time is measured based in uptime.
        Parameters:
        closeTime - The time the restaurant closes.

      • getWaitEstimate

        public int getWaitEstimate()
        This method calculates an approximate wait time for a customer given how many customers are already on the waiting list.
        Returns:
        int The estimated wait time.

      • getTime

        public int getTime()
        This method returns the current Restaurant time.
        Returns:
        int The current time.

      • getCloseTime

        public int getCloseTime()
        This method returns the Restaurant's close time.
        Returns:
        The closetime of the Restaurant.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method creates the test Restaurant which will handle all of our data collection. Through the use of this we may test the different seating options and different wait list handling options.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments to be passed in specifying the restaurant scenario.The first corresponds to the seating preference to use for the restaurant (1-3) and the second corresponds to the waiting list option (1-2).
